title: True when electrostatic equals gravitational force

content.question: Two charged objects are held at a distance d apart. Their mutual gravitational force is equal to their mutual electrostatic force. Which of the following must be true of the charges and masses of the objects, if charge is expressed in C and mass is expressed in kg?

choices.label: The magnitude of the product of the charges must equal the magnitude of the product of the masses.
The magnitude of the product of the charges must be much less than the magnitude of the product of the masses.
The magnitude of the product of the charges must be much greater than the magnitude of the product of the masses.
The charges must be equal and the masses must be equal.

content.answer: The magnitude of the product of the charges must be much less than the magnitude of the product of the masses.

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
